## VectorBuilder.map() method

Constructs a vector by transforming the values of another vector.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
map(vector: Vector<S>, valueFromEntry: VectorEntryFunction<S>): V;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  vector | <code>Vector&lt;S&gt;</code> | The vector on whose entries to base the entries of the new vector |
|  valueFromEntry | <code>VectorEntryFunction&lt;S&gt;</code> | A function which takes an entry of the original vector and its index, and returns the corresponding entry of the new vector |

<b>Returns:</b>

`V`

The new vector

## Example


```
const original = vectorBuilder.fromValues(1, 2, 3, 4);

const originalPlusOne = vectorBuilder.map(original, (value) => value + 1);
// [2, 3, 4, 5]

const originalPlusIndex = vectorBuilder.map(original, (value, index) => value + index);
// [1, 3, 5, 7]

```
